result.execSummary:
The defendant Milton D Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Milton D Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Milton D Robinson in court with attorney Michael Brian Winter.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:06 a.m. Agreement stated - Subject to Def's plea, State moves to amend to misd theft 943.20(1)(a) with penalty under (3)(a), withheld sentence, 9 months probation, costs, no restitution. State has complied with VWNR. Atty Winter and Def agree. Court reviews plea quest. Court grants motion to amend. No contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Winter satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of misd theft. No additional sentencing arguments. Nothing by Defendant. Court asks about length of probation. State presents reasons for 9 months. Statement by Atty Winter. Court will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 9 months probation, costs, DNA sample and surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. No credit if revoked. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Milton D Robinson in court with attorney Michael Brian Winter.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reviewed and waive reading.  Special appearance and reserving all rights.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.   Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
